column4: Why does my trash can show "no items in trash" even after I put things in it?
how are you deleting it ?
just by pressing delte
what application are you deleting it in
blakkheim, erUSUL, just regular delete, using the keyboard, from the computer harddrive (not removable drives)
what application are you deleting in
no application, just from the desktop and folders
to delete from "folders" you must be using an application, such as nautilus
how are you launching nautilus ?

I'm not sure it's nautilus, I'm just deleting item from the Ubuntu desktop by pressing delete on the keyboard...(regular old delete.) I think the problem comes from the fact that I changed the language in Ubuntu from French to English in the folder got mixed up in the name switch..
the language has nothing to do with it
ok
thanks I'll check this out
permissions would be a common issue
ok cool

I found the trash folder (~/.local/share/Trash) with all the deleted files in it  (I also checked permissions, and all was good), but my desktop trash applet still doesn't work. I can't empty my trash.
interesting, the files are in there, so it sounds like the applets bugged
yeah I think you're right
help! I just typed "sudo rm -fr /home/*/.local/share/Trash" in terminal after reading a UbuntuForums post. It didn't fix my trash applet problem and I don't know where the trash folder is now.
you're trash folder is exactly where it was before, however it looks like you've just deleted it
ok...
